Name: Marquita Johnson
Description:
Marquita was shot three times in the face at close range by Juan Lamont Harding.

> The sobbing and crying stilled when the preacher began to talk to those gathered for 17-year-old [deadname] L. Johnson's funeral.
> 
> "I wish I had a remedy that I could shake and this would all go away," the Rev. Sylvester Walker told the mourners at St. Luke Missionary Baptist Church on Wednesday. "But I don't have a remedy... I don't even have any answers."
>
> Priends and family want to know why Johnson was killed, especially now that authorities say the man arrested Tuesday in the slaying had no apparent motive.
> 
> And the people who knew the victim say Johnson spent [her] short, sad life searching for the answer to one question: How can one live as a woman, trapped in a man's body?
> 
> "[They] wanted to be a boy, but It seemed like the part that wanted to be a girl just took over," an aunt, Margery Jones, said.
> 
> Now, despite earlier impressions about the case, authorities don't think Johnson's confused [gender] put [them] in danger the night he was killed.
> 
> Johnson was found by the curb in the 600 block of East Main Street about 3:25 a.m. Friday. Three 25-caliber bullets had been pumped into [her] head at close range, Officials say Johnson and Harding did not know each other.

Name: Tess Hampton ("Miss Tess")
Description:
Tess was stabbed and beaten. Her body was found in a vacant home.

> Police seeking clues in death of [a trans woman]. They found the [person's] body Saturday Oct 23 in a vacant house. [Her] name was [deadname] Hampton but on the street [she] was "Miss Tess” a 36-year-old [trans woman]. [She'd] been beaten to death and stabbed. Police found [her] at 492 Vance Memphis. Homicide detectives are still searching for the killer.
